segment.name: Beginning of message
segment.documentation: BGM, A segment which identifies the document name and the message function code.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, This segment is used to identify the unique project reference number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, The document date will be recorded using this DTM segment.

segment.name: Authentication result
segment.documentation: AUT, A segment used to authenticate the message by exchanging a password or some other form of identification agreed between the trading partners.

segment.name: Agreement identification
segment.documentation: AGR, This segment will be used to identify the "type of contract and form of tender" that apply to this contract.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to record both the structure and contents of the indexing used for the BoQ document.

segment.name: Index details
segment.documentation: IND, A segment to qualify whether the index applies to the whole project, part of a project (a group of items), or whether the index provides an alternative view (analysis) of the work items. The segment also indicates in the index qualifier whether it contains index structure information or describes the index contents.

segment.name: Requirements and conditions
segment.documentation: RCS, A segment used to indicate the action request (add, change etc.) to be applied to the index data.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to specify the position and detailed component parts of the index information.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, This indicator segment specifies one of six positions within the index structure to which the detailed information applies.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to specify the detailed components of the index information.

segment.name: Structure identification
segment.documentation: BII, A segment used to specify a structured index number that is to be associated with the descriptions that follow in segment IMD.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, A segment to specify the descriptions in both full text and abbreviated form . These descriptions to be associated with the contents of segment BII.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: SG7-SG9-SG10-SG18 This information is subordinate to the data provided within the Header section and relates to groups of work items as described in section 1.3.1 of this document. A segment group recording all the details that apply to a group of items. There can be many "Groups of items" within a project and all are to be recorded within this part of the message.

segment.name: Structure identification
segment.documentation: BII, A segment used to convey a structured index number that uniquely identifies each group of items recorded for the project.

segment.name: Requirements and conditions
segment.documentation: RCS, The action to be applied to segment group 4 data is recorded here.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, This indicator segment identifies what category of item grouping.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, The recording of the name and address information applying to this group of items.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, In addition to the name and address details above this is the identification of a location description and an abbreviated or short name by which the grouping is to be known.

segment.name: Additional price information
segment.documentation: APR, A segment to record a multiplication factor called "Timesing" that applies to the entire project or a specific grouping of items.

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, This segment would be used to denote, in a coded form, what rules were adopted for the rounding of all financial values within this group of items.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, This segment enables grouping control quantities to be recorded. These are not to be confused with message control totals that appear later and use the CNT segment.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, Any date details required for the group of items will be recorded using the DTM segment. There are a considerable number of different date qualifiers that could apply.

segment.name: Rate details
segment.documentation: RTE, This segment is used to record a cost rate that may apply to this grouping.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: Some base data about how the information for this group of items was compiled. It will identify the standard method conventions adopted, the author of the data and it will also refer to any "request for quotation" messages that are to be read in conjunction .

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, This segment will be used to specify a series of references, including the reference to a "Request for Quotation" message, standard method identity, the identity of the author of the data and the identity, if appropriate any software tool used during the preparation process.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, The date of the Request for Quotation message that is to be processed in conjunction with this BoQ message.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, An entry in this segment will acknowledge or note the existence of variations to the standard method rules referenced in the associated RFF.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, In the event of variations to the standard method rules this segment will provide any necessary narrative to explain the changes.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: Details of which currency rules apply to this group of items.

segment.name: Currencies
segment.documentation: CUX, Recording details of the currency that applies to the group of items being defined.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, This segment will be used to recorded any dates that are applicable to qualify the currency details recorded in CUX.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, Any narrative necessary to explain or qualify the currency information.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments used to convey details of the price fluctuation calculations to be applied.

segment.name: Allowance or charge
segment.documentation: ALC, A segment to identity whether the data recorded in this segment group represents an actualization or a revision figure.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment providing a reference to the (usually standard) formula rules to be applied.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to record the contract base or control date to be used in the formula.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, Where the formula makes reference to data within a range the details of the range will be identified in this segment.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment to convey the actual formula and narrative relating to the formula. This will be used only in the exceptional case of a non-standard formula being used.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments to specify the remaining components of the price fluctuation calculation.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment to specify a percentage value to be used as a coefficient in conjunction with the reference given in the following RFF.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to specify the reference of a work section applicable to a set of calculation components.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: This segment group is used to record, in textual form, any terms and conditions that are deemed to apply to part or all of the group of items.

segment.name: Requirements and conditions
segment.documentation: RCS, The identity of the particular conditions that are to apply and a coded reference to denote whether this is to be added or changed etc.

segment.name: Structure identification
segment.documentation: BII, A structured index reference to identify to what range within the group of items the conditions apply.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, The narrative description of the condition or term identified by this segment group.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: This segment group is used to record any financial values that apply for a group of items. There are considerable number of different values and qualifiers that will apply.

segment.name: Monetary amount function
segment.documentation: ARD, A segment to record the qualifier to the financial value. This qualifier is in addition to the qualifier used within the following MOA segment.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment to record the value of the monetary amount being defined.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, Any narrative qualification necessary to complete the details about a financial value will be recorded in this segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: Where specific tax rules apply to the entire project or a grouping within the project they will be recorded in this segment group.

segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
segment.documentation: TAX, Where the financial value being described within segment group 10 is a taxation or duty value, details of the tax or duty will be recorded here.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment to specify the actual monetary amount of the tax or duty.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to specify any location details used to qualify the tax details.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: Where it is necessary to express the components that contribute to a monetary value this segment group will be used.

segment.name: Allowance or charge
segment.documentation: ALC, A segment identifying the charge or allowance and where necessary it's calculation sequence.

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, A segment indicating that the allowance or charge specified is subject to special conditions owing to origin, customs preference or commercial factors.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: Components of a financial value expressed in terms of quantities are recorded in this segment group.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, Any quantity details used to define or make precise the monetary value are recorded in this segment.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, Details of the range that applies to the quantity components are expressed in this segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: Components of a financial value expressed in terms of a percentage are recorded in this segment group.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, This segment is used where the financial information is expressed as a percentage or a percentage is required for further qualification.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, Details of the range that applies to the percentage components are expressed in this segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: Any components of a monetary amount that are themselves expressed as monetary amounts are recorded in this segment group.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, The monetary amount component is recorded in this segment.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, Details of the range that applies to the monetary amount components are expressed in this segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: Components of a financial value expressed in terms of a rate are recorded in this segment group.

segment.name: Rate details
segment.documentation: RTE, Any rate details used to define or make precise the monetary value are recorded in this segment.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, Details of the range that applies to the rate components are expressed in this segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: Components of a financial value expressed in terms of a tax or duty are recorded in this segment group.

segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
segment.documentation: TAX, Any tax details used to define or make precise the monetary value are recorded in this segment.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment to specify the actual monetary amount of the tax or duty component.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 18: Name and address information relating to Parties, Banks and Contacts are recorded in this segment group.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, Company name and address that relate to this group of items and that have not been previously notified are recorded in this segment. Each name and address recorded is qualified by the use of the party qualifier 3035.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment used to record more specific location information of the party specified in the NAD segment, e.g. a location within a construction site.

segment.name: Financial institution information
segment.documentation: FII, Bank details associated with these parties recorded in the preceding NAD segment are given here.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, This segment allows for any narrative that may need to accompany the name and address information about a company.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 19: This group of segments will record unique reference numbers by which the party will be known and referenced. This will ensure that each party is uniquely identified even if there is more than one party with a similar qualifier.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, Details of any unique referencing used within the project to identify the party. Not to be confused with the party qualifier in the NAD.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, Date and time details that are used to qualify the party reference number are recorded in this segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 20: This segment group is used to identify documentation related specifically to the party being defined.

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, The identity of the documentation is recorded in this segment.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, Date details used to qualify the documentation are recorded in this segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 21: The information about who to contact within each of the parties detailed in this segment group.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, This segment will contain the identity of the individual, within a company, who is the contact point.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation:
COM, Here is recorded the telephone number etc. that the contact can be reached via.
4.1.2 Detail section
Information to be provided in the Detail section:

segment.name: Section control
segment.documentation: UNS, A service segment placed at the beginning of the detail section to avoid collision.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 22: SG34 A group of segments recording all the details that apply to an item. There can be many items within a project, details of all items, regardless of where they appear in the BoQ will be recorded in this segment group.

segment.name: Structure identification
segment.documentation: BII, A segment used to convey a structured index number that uniquely identifies each item recorded for the project.

segment.name: Requirements and conditions
segment.documentation: RCS, The action to be applied to this segment group data is recorded here.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, Through a list of coded qualifiers this segment is used to define precisely various features about this item e.g.: - it will distinguish between standard, work or sub item types. - identify whether this item is of an agreed, disputed or provisional status. - a qualification of the type of rate that has been associated with this item. - identifying to what category this item resides.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 23: A group of segments recording additional reference information against an item of work.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, Where project documentation has been prepared in accordance with a Standard Methodology the item's reference to that Standard Method is recorded here. Also recorded here is the unique reference number assigned to a sub item. This reference would be used in conjunction with the item index no. in the BII of this segment group.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to record a date for the Standard Method of Measurement reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 24: A group of segments which may be used where Segment Group 23 refers to a sub-item number. It would contain sets of dimension details to further describe the quantities.

segment.name: Dimensions
segment.documentation: DIM, A segment used to record where applicable, the length, width and height for portions of work measured.

segment.name: Additional price information
segment.documentation: APR, A segment to record a multiplication factor called "Timesing" that applies to a set of dimensions.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment to record an annotation for each set of dimensions.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 25: A group of segments to record descriptive text for items and headings for groupings of items.

segment.name: Line item
segment.documentation: LIN, A segment to record a qualifier as to whether it is a description for an item or a heading for a group of items. This would also include a number identifying the level the description applies to, within a set of levelled headings.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 26: A group of segments to record the description line details together with text reference numbers and change action codes used to identify who is authorised to apply changes.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, This segment is used to convey any descriptive material to be recorded for the item. This descriptive material can apply to the item description and item heading information. The distinction is explained in section 1.3 of this paper.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment used to record up to five text reference numbers per item description line.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, A segment used to record up to five text change action codes per item description line.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 27: This segment group is used to record the complex range of quantity values and prices that apply to an item.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, Many different quantity values can be applied to an item during it's execution. All of these quantities will be recorded in this segment.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, This segment is used to provide the qualifiers that apply to the various quantities in the previous segment.

segment.name: Additional price information
segment.documentation: APR, Item quantities are frequently accompanied by some multiplicands. This APR segment is used to record these.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 28: A group of segments to record a series of prices and monetary amounts relating to each QTY value.

segment.name: Price details
segment.documentation: PRI, A segment to record up to three price values for each QTY value.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, A segment to record up to three qualifiers for each price.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 29: A group of segments to record the monetary amounts, currency, tax details resulting from the multiplication of QTY and PRI values.

segment.name: Monetary amount function
segment.documentation: ARD, A segment to qualify the monetary amount as to it's purpose in the business exchange.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment to record the value and currency of the monetary amount.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 30: A group of segments in which is detailed taxation information, which applies to the item . There are often several different types of tax which need to be applied.

segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
segment.documentation: TAX, Details of the taxation to be applied is recorded here.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment to record the value and currency of the monetary amount.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to specify location codes relating to the tax details recorded in this segment group.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 31: Where it is necessary to record a relationship about the current item and it's association with another item, this segment group will be used.

segment.name: Requirements and conditions
segment.documentation: RCS, A segment to identify the requirements that applied to this particular reference.

segment.name: Structure identification
segment.documentation: BII, Record here the structured index number of the other item to which the current item relates.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, This is the segment where a coded reference describing the item relationship is recorded.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 32: A group of segments used to convey details of the price fluctuation calculations to be applied to the item.

segment.name: Allowance or charge
segment.documentation: ALC, A segment to identity whether the data recorded in this segment group represents an actualization or a revision figure.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment providing a reference to the (usually standard) formula rules to be applied.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to record the contract base or control date to be used in the formula.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, Where the formula makes reference to data within a range the details of the range will be identified in this segment.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment to convey the actual formula and narrative relating to the formula . This will be used only in the exceptional case of a non- standard formula being used.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 33: A group of segments to specify the remaining components of the price fluctuation calculation.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment to specify a percentage value to be used as a coefficient in conjunction with the reference given in the following RFF.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to specify the reference of a work section applicable to a set of calculation components.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 34: A segment group to record where necessary alternative index information for an item. The validity of an alternative index would be defined in the Segment Group 3 IMD.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, A segment used to record an alternative index description (previously defined in Segment Group 3 IMD), that relates to this item.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment to record the quantity and measurement unit that relates to the coded entry for the item.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment to record the currency and value associated with the item.

segment.name: Price details
segment.documentation:
PRI, A segment to record the monetary rate of the code associated with the item.
4.1.3 Summary section
Information to be provided in the Summary section:

segment.name: Control total
segment.documentation: CNT, Various control total checks may be taken and the resultant values would be recorded in this segment. Typically these checks will be counts of quantity and monetary values that apply to the entire message.
